choices.A: The state of the case will change to Resolved and the state will change to Canceled.
choices.B: The state of the case will change to Merged and the state will change to Merged.
choices.D: The state of the case will change to Canceled and the state will change to Merged.
choices.C: The state of the case will change to Deleted and the state will change to Resolved.

questions.question_text:
You are employed as an administrator for your companyâ€™s Dynamics 365 for Customer Service implementation.

You are preparing to merge duplicate cases.

Which of the following is TRUE with regards to the state of the case and the status after these duplicate cases have been merged?

discussion.content: D...this is poorly worded though LOL

comments.content: Agree is D, but the wordings are strange

questions.question_text:
Your company makes use of Dynamics 365 for Customer Service.

You need to assign a case in the queue that is currently routed to you to a different user because you have booked time off work.

You release the case.

Does the action achieve your objective?

discussion.content: Releasing the case will make it available for another agent to pick the case to work on, this is not the same as assigning the case to another user, but still solves the problem I believe
Sharing the case does not change who the case is assigned to, No this won't solve the problem

questions.question_text:
Your company makes use of Dynamics 365 for Customer Service.

You need to assign a case in the queue that is currently routed to you to a different user because you have booked time off work.

You share the case.

Does the action achieve your objective?

Your company makes use of Dynamics 365 for Customer Service.

You need to assign a case in the queue that is currently routed to you to a different user because you have booked time off work.

You delete the case.

Does the action achieve your objective?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer should be no. This is not enabled by default
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/admin/configure-quick-find?view=op-9-1#what-system-administrators-should-consider-before-enabling-or-disabling-full-text-indexing

questions.question_text:
Your company makes use of Dynamics 365 Customer Service with the default settings unchanged.

You want to find like cases in the system using a default search feature.

You make use of Full-text Quick Find.

Does the action achieve your objective?
